Package org.world.agents.enemies

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
org.world.GameObject
org.world.agents.enemies.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SecurityBot
public abstract class Enemy
extends GameObject
Basic enemy template, adds some useful variables and methods to the GameObject superclass. Actual behaviour( general ai, death and damage behaviour) and characteristics(sprite, sounds) are defined in subclasses. The render() and update() functions should not be overridden since they provide all the needed functionality.

  • Field Details

    • damaged

      boolean damaged
      Is set when enemy is in a damaged state

    • damageStateDuration

      int damageStateDuration
      The duration of the damaged state. While being in this state enemies can not be damaged again

    • attacking

      boolean attacking
      Is set when the enemy is attacking

    • currentAttackTime

      int currentAttackTime
      Counts the time spend imn the attacking state

    • canBeStaggered

      boolean canBeStaggered
      Flags whether enemie can be staggered, i.e. pushed back or interrupted by the player's attacks

    • scoreValue

      int scoreValue
      How many points the player is awarded for killing this particular enemy

    • stabbable

      boolean stabbable
      If this particular enemy can be stabbed/picked up by the player

    • dead

      boolean dead
      Flags this enemy as dead. Dead enemies do nothing in their update cycle

    • thrown

      public boolean thrown
      If this enemy has been thrown by the player

    • invulnerable

      private boolean invulnerable
      Flags this enemy as invulnerable (cannot be damaged by the player)

    • stabAnimation

      protected int stabAnimation
      The index of the animation played while being stabbed/carried by the player. It is necessary to have this as a field since animations vary in number and name by game object

    • wait

      int wait
      Waiting time until next action. When set the enemy does nothing in it's update cycle

    • xInertia

      public int xInertia
      Horizontal inertia value. If different from 0 the enemy will be pushed either left or right depending on sign

    • yInertia

      public int yInertia
      Vertical inertia value. If different from 0 the enemy will be pushed either left or right depending on sign

    • health

      int health
      Amount of health the enemy possesses. When health reaches 0 the enemy is marked as dead

    • inertia

      float inertia
      Inertia value, decides the impact of the x/yInertia values

    • speed

      float speed
      Movement speed

    • moving

      boolean moving
      Is set when the enemy is moving

    • path

      java.util.ArrayList<Point> path
      Currently used path

    • currentDestination

      Point currentDestination
      Current destination point, not the final one

    • finalDestination

      int[] finalDestination
      Coordinates of the currently set final destination

    • shadow

      Shadow shadow

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy()

  • Method Details

    • thrownBehaviour

      private void thrownBehaviour()
      Handles being thrown. Code shared between all enemies that can be thrown. Enemy moves in the direction given by the inertia variables until reaching an obstacle,a tile that is higher than it, or the inertia values reach 0. Upon stopping the enemy dies immediately. In case the obstacle hit is another enemy, both enemies will be killed.

    • deathBehaviour

      abstract void deathBehaviour()
      Implemented in subclasses. Defines what happens when this enemy's health falls below 0.

    • inertiaBehaviour

      private void inertiaBehaviour()
      Defines what happens when this enemy has nonzero inertia values but is not thrown. Pushes enemy in the direction given by the inertia values.

    • damageBehaviour

      abstract void damageBehaviour()
      Implemented in subclasses. Defines what enemy should do in case it is damaged.

    • ai

      abstract void ai()
      Implemented in subclass. Defines general behaviour when left on it's own/not interrupted by attacks or otherwise. Should set the attacking flag to true in case an attack is desired. Actions pertaining to attacks should be handled in the attack() method.

    • canMove

      private boolean canMove​(int x, int y)
      Checks whether moving to a given tile is possible. Accounts for the current height difference. Validity of the coordinates is checked by a call to the AI.isTraversable(int x, int y) method
      Parameters:
      x - isometric coordinate of the tile
      y - isometric coordinate of the tile

    • update

      public void update()
      Does all the relevant updates. It is modular, subclasses should override the various behaviour methods instead of this to implement the actual functionality. In case the enemy is dead, the method returns instantly. The override-able sub-method call order is: deathBehaviour() and freeResources(), if health less than 0; damageBehaviour() if damaged; ai() if not moving and not attacking or attack() otherwise. Only one of the groups of methods above can be executed in on update cycle, the method returns after entering one execution branch.
      Specified by:
      update in class GameObject

    • attack

      abstract void attack()
      Defined in subclass. This method should handle all possible attack actions the enemy is capable of. After an attack is finished the attacking flag should be set to false to allow the enemy to execute other actions

    • damage

      protected void damage​(int damage)
      Deal damage to this enemy. Does nothing if enemy is marked as being invulnerable at time of calling
      Parameters:
      damage - amount of damage

    • checkForDamage

      protected void checkForDamage()
      This class is actually used to check for damage, it in turn calls the checkForHit method and handles some other actions like the player's lifesteal and if enemy has been stabbed/skewered

    • checkForHit

      private boolean checkForHit​(HitBox damageBox)
      Checks if this enemy has been hit by the player by checking all the damage points in the current hit box given by the attack type and animation frame
      Parameters:
      damageBox - Player's weapon's hitbox
      Returns:
      true if hit, false if not

    • moveToCoords

      public void moveToCoords​(float x, float y)
      Attempts to move an enemy towards the position given by x,y. Ensures the enemy does not end up in an illegal position in the current game world even if the given coordinates are unreachable. The coordinates refer to points on th ground. The height of the destination is not needed since it can be deduced from the Tile information TODO Better collision detection, especially with other enemies
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate in the game world
      y - coordinate in the game world

    • moveToPoint

      public void moveToPoint​(int x, int y)
      Moves to a set of (int) isometric coordinates by calculating the real world (float) coordinates and calling the moveToCoords(float, float) method
      Parameters:
      x - isometric coordinate
      y - isometric coordinate

    • render

      public void render()
      Description copied from class: GameObject
      Renders the object when necessary, is overridden in some instances(ex. Player, Tiles) when more/different functionality is needed
      Overrides:
      render in class GameObject

    • updateShadow

      public void updateShadow()
      updates this enemy's shadow if it exists

    • renderShadow

      private void renderShadow()
      renders this enemy's shadow if it exists

    • freeResources

      abstract void freeResources()

    • getStabAnimation

      public int getStabAnimation()
      Returns the enemy's stab animation index
      Returns:
      index in the animation array

    • setInvulnerable

      public void setInvulnerable​(boolean invulnerable)
      Marks this enemy as invulnerable. Invulnerable enemies cannot be damaged
